page.title: 14Flora of the Grafham Area.
page.content: This summary is based on a survey of representative sites in our area by Dr B.N.K.Davis of the Nature Conservancy, Monks Wood Experimental Station. Over a{hundred species}were recorded which does not include grasses and mosses. Of these hundred species five are designated as being rare. These are Wood Spurge, Adder's Tongue Fern, Greater Butterfly Orchid, Elecampane and False Oxlip. Four main zones with their characteristic flora are to be found in the area. The first, the{old {pasture}on the north shore of Grafham Water produces rich calcicole flora with Spindle Wayfaring Tree , Fairy Flax and Pepper Saxifrage with Bluebell, Primrose and Lesser Celandine at the edge of the woodlands.
